subject: Self Care
title: Cognitive Empathy
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Cognitive Empathy.

hook.text: You can understand why someone is angry without feeling angry yourself. That's cognitive empathy at work.

buildup.text: Cognitive empathy is perspective-taking ‚Äî mentally stepping into someone's shoes to understand their viewpoint.

discovery.text: It's different from emotional empathy, which means literally feeling what another person feels. Both matter.

twist.text: Cognitive empathy without emotional empathy can be cold. Emotional empathy without cognitive can be overwhelming.

climax.text: The ideal is both: understand the perspective and feel genuine concern. Together, they create true connection.

punchline.text: Understand the mind. Feel the heart. That's full empathy.

quiz.question: What is cognitive empathy?
options: Mentally understanding someone's perspective and viewpoint
